DETAILED FINDINGS
============================================================

[1] Exposed Secret: Generic Secret Assignment in Config
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: CRITICAL
Category: secrets
CWE: CWE-798 - Hardcoded Credentials
CVSS: 9.8 (Critical)
Location: frontend/src/config/contracts.defaults.ts:65

Risk & Fix:
Sensitive values in source code can be discovered through code leaks, decompilation, or git history. Fix: Store secrets in environment variables or a secrets manager.

Suggested Fix:
Move to environment variable and rotate the exposed secret immediately

Fix: Move to Environment Variables
Estimated Time: 10-15 min
Difficulty: EASY

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: Hardcoded API key
const API_KEY = "sk-abc123xyz789";
const client = new OpenAI({ apiKey: API_KEY });

After (Safe):
// Safe: Environment variable
const client = new OpenAI({
  apiKey: process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY
});

// .env file (add to .gitignore!)
// OPENAI_API_KEY=sk-abc123xyz789

// For client-side (Next.js/Vite)
// Use NEXT_PUBLIC_ or VITE_ prefix only for non-sensitive keys

// Vulnerable: Hardcoded API key

const client = new OpenAI({ apiKey: API_KEY });

After (Safe):
// Safe: Environment variable

  apiKey: process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY
});

// .env file (add to .gitignore!)
// OPENAI_API_KEY=sk-abc123xyz789

// For client-side (Next.js/Vite)
// Use NEXT_PUBLIC_ or VITE_ prefix only for non-sensitive keys

// OPENAI_API_KEY=sk-abc123xyz789

// For client-side (Next.js/Vite)
// Use NEXT_PUBLIC_ or VITE_ prefix only for non-sensitive keys


[51] Exposed Secret: Generic Secret Assignment in Config
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: CRITICAL
Category: secrets
CWE: CWE-798 - Hardcoded Credentials
CVSS: 9.8 (Critical)
Location: frontend/src/config/contracts.ts:102

Risk & Fix:
Sensitive values in source code can be discovered through code leaks, decompilation, or git history. Fix: Store secrets in environment variables or a secrets manager.

Suggested Fix:
Move to environment variable and rotate the exposed secret immediately

Fix: Move to Environment Variables
Estimated Time: 10-15 min
Difficulty: EASY

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: Hardcoded API key
const API_KEY = "sk-abc123xyz789";
const client = new OpenAI({ apiKey: API_KEY });

After (Safe):
// Safe: Environment variable
const client = new OpenAI({
  apiKey: process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY
});

// .env file (add to .gitignore!)
// OPENAI_API_KEY=sk-abc123xyz789

// For client-side (Next.js/Vite)
// Use NEXT_PUBLIC_ or VITE_ prefix only for non-sensitive keys

// Use NEXT_PUBLIC_ or VITE_ prefix only for non-sensitive keys


[76] Exposed Secret: Generic Secret Assignment in Config
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: CRITICAL
Category: secrets
CWE: CWE-798 - Hardcoded Credentials
CVSS: 9.8 (Critical)
Location: frontend/src/pages/DeployVault.tsx:1492

Risk & Fix:
Sensitive values in source code can be discovered through code leaks, decompilation, or git history. Fix: Store secrets in environment variables or a secrets manager.

Suggested Fix:
Move to environment variable and rotate the exposed secret immediately

Fix: Move to Environment Variables
Estimated Time: 10-15 min
Difficulty: EASY

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: Hardcoded API key
const API_KEY = "sk-abc123xyz789";
const client = new OpenAI({ apiKey: API_KEY });

After (Safe):
// Safe: Environment variable
const client = new OpenAI({
  apiKey: process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY
});

// .env file (add to .gitignore!)
// OPENAI_API_KEY=sk-abc123xyz789

// For client-side (Next.js/Vite)
// Use NEXT_PUBLIC_ or VITE_ prefix only for non-sensitive keys

[82] Dangerous eval() call - potential code injection vulnerability
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: HIGH
Category: code
CWE: CWE-95 - Eval Injection
CVSS: 9.8 (Critical)
Location: frontend/api/sync-vault-data.ts:14

Risk & Fix:
eval() executes arbitrary code, giving attackers complete control if they can influence the input. Fix: Use JSON.parse() for data, avoid eval entirely.

Fix: Remove eval() Usage
Estimated Time: 15-30 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: Code injection via eval
const result = eval(userExpression);

// Also dangerous
const fn = new Function('return ' + userCode);

After (Safe):
// Safe: Use JSON.parse for data
const data = JSON.parse(userJson);

// For math expressions, use a safe parser
import { evaluate } from 'mathjs';
const result = evaluate(userExpression); // Only allows math

// For config, use static mapping
const handlers = {
  'add': (a, b) => a + b,
  'subtract': (a, b) => a - b
};
const result = handlers[operation]?.(a, b);


[83] Drizzle SQL with direct interpolation - use sql.placeholder() for user input (CWE-89)
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: HIGH
Category: code
Location: frontend/api/admin/creator-access/allowlist.ts:89

Risk & Fix:
This pattern was flagged as a potential security issue. Review the code context and apply the recommended fix to prevent exploitation.

Fix: Use Parameterized Queries
Estimated Time: 5-10 min
Difficulty: EASY

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: SQL Injection
const userId = req.params.id;
const query = "SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = " + userId;
db.query(query);

After (Safe):
// Safe: Parameterized Query
const userId = req.params.id;
const query = "SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = $1";
db.query(query, [userId]);

[94] Pug unescaped output (!=) with concatenation - XSS vulnerability
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: HIGH
Category: code
Location: frontend/api/creator-access/status.ts:61

Risk & Fix:
Attackers can inject malicious scripts that run in your users' browsers, stealing sessions, credentials, or personal data. Fix: Sanitize all user input before rendering, use textContent instead of innerHTML.

Fix: Use textContent or Sanitize HTML
Estimated Time: 5-15 min
Difficulty: EASY

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: XSS via innerHTML
element.innerHTML = userInput;

// React vulnerable pattern
<div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: userContent}} />

After (Safe):
// Safe: Use textContent for plain text
element.textContent = userInput;

// If HTML is needed, sanitize with DOMPurify
import DOMPurify from 'dompurify';
element.innerHTML = DOMPurify.sanitize(userInput);

// React with sanitization
<div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{
  __html: DOMPurify.sanitize(userContent)
}} />

[701] Bash unquoted path - may cause unexpected behavior
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: MEDIUM
Category: code
Location: script/generate_frontend_deploy_bytecode.sh:12

Risk & Fix:
This pattern was flagged as a potential security issue. Review the code context and apply the recommended fix to prevent exploitation.

Fix: Validate and Sanitize File Paths
Estimated Time: 10-15 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: Path traversal
const filename = req.query.file;
const content = fs.readFileSync(`./uploads/${filename}`);

After (Safe):
import path from 'path';

const UPLOAD_DIR = path.resolve('./uploads');

function getSafePath(filename) {
  // Remove any path components
  const safeName = path.basename(filename);
  const fullPath = path.resolve(UPLOAD_DIR, safeName);

  // Ensure path is within upload directory
  if (!fullPath.startsWith(UPLOAD_DIR)) {
    throw new Error('Invalid path');
  }

  return fullPath;
}

const safePath = getSafePath(req.query.file);
const content = fs.readFileSync(safePath);


[702] Bash unquoted path - may cause unexpected behavior
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: MEDIUM
Category: code
Location: script/generate_frontend_deploy_bytecode.sh:15

Risk & Fix:
This pattern was flagged as a potential security issue. Review the code context and apply the recommended fix to prevent exploitation.

Fix: Validate and Sanitize File Paths
Estimated Time: 10-15 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: Path traversal
const filename = req.query.file;
const content = fs.readFileSync(`./uploads/${filename}`);

After (Safe):
import path from 'path';

const UPLOAD_DIR = path.resolve('./uploads');

function getSafePath(filename) {
  // Remove any path components
  const safeName = path.basename(filename);
  const fullPath = path.resolve(UPLOAD_DIR, safeName);

  // Ensure path is within upload directory
  if (!fullPath.startsWith(UPLOAD_DIR)) {
    throw new Error('Invalid path');
  }

  return fullPath;
}

const safePath = getSafePath(req.query.file);
const content = fs.readFileSync(safePath);

[711] Specific error for missing user enables username enumeration (CWE-204)
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: MEDIUM
Category: code
Location: script/deploy-with-aa.ts:331

Risk & Fix:
This pattern was flagged as a potential security issue. Review the code context and apply the recommended fix to prevent exploitation.

Fix: Add Authentication Middleware
Estimated Time: 15-30 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: No auth check
export async function GET(request) {
  const users = await db.users.findMany();
  return Response.json(users);
}

After (Safe):
// Safe: With authentication
import { getServerSession } from 'next-auth';

export async function GET(request) {
  const session = await getServerSession();

  if (!session) {
    return Response.json({ error: 'Unauthorized' }, { status: 401 });
  }

  const users = await db.users.findMany();
  return Response.json(users);
}


[712] Specific error for missing user enables username enumeration (CWE-204)
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: MEDIUM
Category: code
Location: script/deploy-with-aa.ts:389

Risk & Fix:
This pattern was flagged as a potential security issue. Review the code context and apply the recommended fix to prevent exploitation.

Fix: Add Authentication Middleware
Estimated Time: 15-30 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: No auth check
export async function GET(request) {
  const users = await db.users.findMany();
  return Response.json(users);
}

After (Safe):
// Safe: With authentication
import { getServerSession } from 'next-auth';

export async function GET(request) {
  const session = await getServerSession();

  if (!session) {
    return Response.json({ error: 'Unauthorized' }, { status: 401 });
  }

  const users = await db.users.findMany();
  return Response.json(users);
}


[713] '@ts-ignore suppresses TypeScript errors - review carefully'
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: MEDIUM
Category: code
Location: frontend/src/pages/CoinManage.tsx:345

Risk & Fix:
This pattern was flagged as a potential security issue. Review the code context and apply the recommended fix to prevent exploitation.


[714] Fetch API with potentially user-controlled URL - validate to prevent SSRF
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: MEDIUM
Category: code
CWE: CWE-918 - Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF)
CVSS: 7.5 (High)
Location: frontend/src/pages/Status.tsx:167

Risk & Fix:
Server-Side Request Forgery allows attackers to make your server fetch internal resources, potentially accessing private APIs or cloud metadata. Fix: Validate URLs and block private IP ranges.

Fix: Validate and Whitelist URLs
Estimated Time: 15-20 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: SSRF
const url = req.body.webhookUrl;
const response = await fetch(url);

After (Safe):
import { URL } from 'url';

const ALLOWED_HOSTS = ['api.example.com', 'webhook.example.com'];

function validateUrl(urlString) {
  const url = new URL(urlString);

  // Block private IPs and localhost
  const blockedPatterns = [
    /^localhost$/i,
    /^127\./,
    /^10\./,
    /^172\.(1[6-9]|2[0-9]|3[0-1])\./,
    /^192\.168\./,
    /^0\./
  ];

  if (blockedPatterns.some(p => p.test(url.hostname))) {
    throw new Error('Invalid URL: private addresses not allowed');
  }

  // Optionally: whitelist specific hosts
  if (!ALLOWED_HOSTS.includes(url.hostname)) {
    throw new Error('Invalid URL: host not allowed');
  }

  return url.href;
}

const safeUrl = validateUrl(req.body.webhookUrl);
const response = await fetch(safeUrl);


[715] Pug unescaped output - XSS risk if variable contains user input
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: MEDIUM
Category: code
Location: frontend/src/pages/Status.tsx:528

Risk & Fix:
Attackers can inject malicious scripts that run in your users' browsers, stealing sessions, credentials, or personal data. Fix: Sanitize all user input before rendering, use textContent instead of innerHTML.

Fix: Use textContent or Sanitize HTML
Estimated Time: 5-15 min
Difficulty: EASY

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: XSS via innerHTML
element.innerHTML = userInput;

// React vulnerable pattern
<div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: userContent}} />

After (Safe):
// Safe: Use textContent for plain text
element.textContent = userInput;

// If HTML is needed, sanitize with DOMPurify
import DOMPurify from 'dompurify';
element.innerHTML = DOMPurify.sanitize(userInput);

// React with sanitization
<div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{
  __html: DOMPurify.sanitize(userContent)
}} />

[736] Specific error for missing user enables username enumeration (CWE-204)
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: MEDIUM
Category: code
Location: frontend/src/pages/Faq.tsx:715

Risk & Fix:
This pattern was flagged as a potential security issue. Review the code context and apply the recommended fix to prevent exploitation.

Fix: Add Authentication Middleware
Estimated Time: 15-30 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: No auth check
export async function GET(request) {
  const users = await db.users.findMany();
  return Response.json(users);
}

After (Safe):
// Safe: With authentication
import { getServerSession } from 'next-auth';

export async function GET(request) {
  const session = await getServerSession();

  if (!session) {
    return Response.json({ error: 'Unauthorized' }, { status: 401 });
  }

  const users = await db.users.findMany();
  return Response.json(users);
}

Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: No auth check

  return Response.json(users);

After (Safe):
// Safe: With authentication
import { getServerSession } from 'next-auth';

export async function GET(request) {
  const session = await getServerSession();

  if (!session) {
    return Response.json({ error: 'Unauthorized' }, { status: 401 });
  }

  const users = await db.users.findMany();
  return Response.json(users);
}

[774] Fetch API with potentially user-controlled URL - validate to prevent SSRF
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: MEDIUM
Category: code
CWE: CWE-918 - Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF)
CVSS: 7.5 (High)
Location: frontend/src/hooks/useTokenMetadata.ts:93

Risk & Fix:
Server-Side Request Forgery allows attackers to make your server fetch internal resources, potentially accessing private APIs or cloud metadata. Fix: Validate URLs and block private IP ranges.

Fix: Validate and Whitelist URLs
Estimated Time: 15-20 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: SSRF
const url = req.body.webhookUrl;
const response = await fetch(url);

After (Safe):
import { URL } from 'url';

const ALLOWED_HOSTS = ['api.example.com', 'webhook.example.com'];

function validateUrl(urlString) {
  const url = new URL(urlString);

  // Block private IPs and localhost
  const blockedPatterns = [
    /^localhost$/i,
    /^127\./,
    /^10\./,
    /^172\.(1[6-9]|2[0-9]|3[0-1])\./,
    /^192\.168\./,
    /^0\./
  ];

  if (blockedPatterns.some(p => p.test(url.hostname))) {
    throw new Error('Invalid URL: private addresses not allowed');
  }

  // Optionally: whitelist specific hosts
  if (!ALLOWED_HOSTS.includes(url.hostname)) {
    throw new Error('Invalid URL: host not allowed');
  }

  return url.href;
}

const safeUrl = validateUrl(req.body.webhookUrl);
const response = await fetch(safeUrl);

[780] Access-Control-Allow-Origin: * allows any origin (CWE-942)
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: MEDIUM
Category: code
Location: frontend/api/analytics.ts:24

Risk & Fix:
Broken access control is consistently in OWASP Top 10. Users can access unauthorized functions or data. Fix: Implement proper permission checks.


[781] CORS allows all origins - restrict to trusted domains
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: MEDIUM
Category: code
CWE: CWE-942 - Permissive CORS Policy
CVSS: 5.3 (Medium)
Location: frontend/api/analytics.ts:24

Risk & Fix:
Permissive CORS (Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *) lets any website make authenticated requests to your API. Fix: Specify exact allowed origins instead of using wildcards.

Fix: Restrict CORS Origins
Estimated Time: 10-15 min
Difficulty: EASY

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: Allows any origin
app.use(cors({ origin: '*' }));

After (Safe):
// Safe: Whitelist specific origins
const allowedOrigins = [
  'https://yourapp.com',
  'https://staging.yourapp.com',
  process.env.NODE_ENV === 'development' && 'http://localhost:3000'
].filter(Boolean);

app.use(cors({
  origin: (origin, callback) => {
    if (!origin || allowedOrigins.includes(origin)) {
      callback(null, true);
    } else {
      callback(new Error('Not allowed by CORS'));
    }
  },
  credentials: true
}));


[782] Dynamic property assignment - prototype pollution if key is user-controlled
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: MEDIUM
Category: code
Location: frontend/api/analytics.ts:57

Risk & Fix:
This pattern was flagged as a potential security issue. Review the code context and apply the recommended fix to prevent exploitation.

Category: code
Location: frontend/api/onchain/coinMarketRewardsByCoin.ts:22

Risk & Fix:

[806] Specific error for missing user enables username enumeration (CWE-204)
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: MEDIUM
Category: code
Location: frontend/api/paymaster.ts:284

Risk & Fix:
This pattern was flagged as a potential security issue. Review the code context and apply the recommended fix to prevent exploitation.

Fix: Add Authentication Middleware
Estimated Time: 15-30 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: No auth check
export async function GET(request) {
  const users = await db.users.findMany();
  return Response.json(users);
}

After (Safe):
// Safe: With authentication
import { getServerSession } from 'next-auth';

export async function GET(request) {
  const session = await getServerSession();

  if (!session) {
    return Response.json({ error: 'Unauthorized' }, { status: 401 });
  }

  const users = await db.users.findMany();
  return Response.json(users);
}

--------------------------------------------------

      callback(null, true);
    } else {
      callback(new Error('Not allowed by CORS'));
    }
  },
  credentials: true
}));


[823] Credential enumeration - use generic "Invalid username or password" message
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: MEDIUM
Category: code
CWE: CWE-798 - Hardcoded Credentials
CVSS: 9.8 (Critical)
Location: frontend/api/social/twitter.ts:70

Risk & Fix:
Passwords in code are a severe security risk. Anyone with code access can authenticate as that user/service. Fix: Remove immediately, use environment variables, rotate the password.

[826] Pug unescaped output - XSS risk if variable contains user input
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: MEDIUM
Category: code
Location: frontend/api/creator-access/request.ts:78

Risk & Fix:
Attackers can inject malicious scripts that run in your users' browsers, stealing sessions, credentials, or personal data. Fix: Sanitize all user input before rendering, use textContent instead of innerHTML.

Fix: Use textContent or Sanitize HTML
Estimated Time: 5-15 min
Difficulty: EASY

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: XSS via innerHTML
element.innerHTML = userInput;

// React vulnerable pattern
<div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: userContent}} />

After (Safe):
// Safe: Use textContent for plain text
element.textContent = userInput;

// If HTML is needed, sanitize with DOMPurify
import DOMPurify from 'dompurify';
element.innerHTML = DOMPurify.sanitize(userInput);

// React with sanitization
<div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{
  __html: DOMPurify.sanitize(userContent)
}} />


[827] Access-Control-Allow-Origin: * allows any origin (CWE-942)
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: MEDIUM
Category: code
Location: frontend/api/debank/_shared.ts:6

Risk & Fix:
Broken access control is consistently in OWASP Top 10. Users can access unauthorized functions or data. Fix: Implement proper permission checks.


[828] CORS allows all origins - restrict to trusted domains
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: MEDIUM
Category: code
CWE: CWE-942 - Permissive CORS Policy
CVSS: 5.3 (Medium)
Location: frontend/api/debank/_shared.ts:6

Risk & Fix:
Permissive CORS (Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *) lets any website make authenticated requests to your API. Fix: Specify exact allowed origins instead of using wildcards.

Fix: Restrict CORS Origins
Estimated Time: 10-15 min
Difficulty: EASY

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: Allows any origin
app.use(cors({ origin: '*' }));

After (Safe):
// Safe: Whitelist specific origins
const allowedOrigins = [
  'https://yourapp.com',
  'https://staging.yourapp.com',
  process.env.NODE_ENV === 'development' && 'http://localhost:3000'
].filter(Boolean);

app.use(cors({
  origin: (origin, callback) => {
    if (!origin || allowedOrigins.includes(origin)) {
      callback(null, true);
    } else {
      callback(new Error('Not allowed by CORS'));
    }
  },
  credentials: true
}));

[1059] Using blockhash for randomness - miners can manipulate this value
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: MEDIUM
Category: code
CWE: CWE-328 - Weak Hash
CVSS: 7.5 (High)
Location: contracts/vault/strategies/AjnaStrategy.sol:283

Risk & Fix:
Math.random() is not cryptographically secure and can be predicted. Fix: Use the crypto module for generating tokens, secrets, or IDs.

Fix: Use bcrypt or Argon2
Estimated Time: 15-20 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: MD5/SHA1 is not suitable for passwords
const hash = crypto.createHash('md5').update(password).digest('hex');

After (Safe):
// Safe: Use bcrypt
import bcrypt from 'bcrypt';

// Hashing (on registration)
const saltRounds = 12;
const hash = await bcrypt.hash(password, saltRounds);

// Verification (on login)
const isValid = await bcrypt.compare(password, storedHash);


[1060] Using current balance instead of cached value - vulnerable to donation/flash loan attacks (Yield Protocol pattern)
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: MEDIUM
Category: code
Location: contracts/vault/strategies/AjnaStrategy.sol:300

Risk & Fix:
This pattern was flagged as a potential security issue. Review the code context and apply the recommended fix to prevent exploitation.


[1061] Using blockhash for randomness - miners can manipulate this value
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: MEDIUM
Category: code
CWE: CWE-328 - Weak Hash
CVSS: 7.5 (High)
Location: contracts/vault/strategies/AjnaStrategy.sol:330

Risk & Fix:
Math.random() is not cryptographically secure and can be predicted. Fix: Use the crypto module for generating tokens, secrets, or IDs.

Fix: Use bcrypt or Argon2
Estimated Time: 15-20 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: MD5/SHA1 is not suitable for passwords
const hash = crypto.createHash('md5').update(password).digest('hex');

After (Safe):
// Safe: Use bcrypt
import bcrypt from 'bcrypt';

// Hashing (on registration)
const saltRounds = 12;
const hash = await bcrypt.hash(password, saltRounds);

// Verification (on login)
const isValid = await bcrypt.compare(password, storedHash);

[1145] Using blockhash for randomness - miners can manipulate this value
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: MEDIUM
Category: code
CWE: CWE-328 - Weak Hash
CVSS: 7.5 (High)
Location: contracts/vault/strategies/univ3/CharmAlphaVaultDeploy.sol:130

Risk & Fix:
Math.random() is not cryptographically secure and can be predicted. Fix: Use the crypto module for generating tokens, secrets, or IDs.

Fix: Use bcrypt or Argon2
Estimated Time: 15-20 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: MD5/SHA1 is not suitable for passwords
const hash = crypto.createHash('md5').update(password).digest('hex');

After (Safe):
// Safe: Use bcrypt
import bcrypt from 'bcrypt';

// Hashing (on registration)
const saltRounds = 12;
const hash = await bcrypt.hash(password, saltRounds);

// Verification (on login)
const isValid = await bcrypt.compare(password, storedHash);

[1213] Code after return/revert/throw - unreachable and likely a logic error
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: MEDIUM

Risk & Fix:
This pattern was flagged as a potential security issue. Review the code context and apply the recommended fix to prevent exploitation.


[1214] Using blockhash for randomness - miners can manipulate this value
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: MEDIUM
Category: code
CWE: CWE-328 - Weak Hash
CVSS: 7.5 (High)
Location: contracts/vault/strategies/univ4/ConcentratedStrategy.sol:338

Risk & Fix:
Math.random() is not cryptographically secure and can be predicted. Fix: Use the crypto module for generating tokens, secrets, or IDs.

Fix: Use bcrypt or Argon2
Estimated Time: 15-20 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: MD5/SHA1 is not suitable for passwords
const hash = crypto.createHash('md5').update(password).digest('hex');

After (Safe):
// Safe: Use bcrypt
import bcrypt from 'bcrypt';

// Hashing (on registration)
const saltRounds = 12;
const hash = await bcrypt.hash(password, saltRounds);

// Verification (on login)
const isValid = await bcrypt.compare(password, storedHash);

[1234] Using blockhash for randomness - miners can manipulate this value
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: MEDIUM
Category: code
CWE: CWE-328 - Weak Hash
CVSS: 7.5 (High)
Location: contracts/vault/strategies/univ4/ConcentratedStrategy.sol:474

Risk & Fix:
Math.random() is not cryptographically secure and can be predicted. Fix: Use the crypto module for generating tokens, secrets, or IDs.

Fix: Use bcrypt or Argon2
Estimated Time: 15-20 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: MD5/SHA1 is not suitable for passwords
const hash = crypto.createHash('md5').update(password).digest('hex');

After (Safe):
// Safe: Use bcrypt
import bcrypt from 'bcrypt';

// Hashing (on registration)
const saltRounds = 12;
const hash = await bcrypt.hash(password, saltRounds);

// Verification (on login)
const isValid = await bcrypt.compare(password, storedHash);

[1280] Utilization rate calculation without upper bound - can exceed 100% causing inflated interest (Silo Finance pattern)
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: MEDIUM
Category: code
Location: contracts/vault/strategies/univ4/CreatorLPManager.sol:385

Risk & Fix:
This pattern was flagged as a potential security issue. Review the code context and apply the recommended fix to prevent exploitation.


[1281] Using blockhash for randomness - miners can manipulate this value
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: MEDIUM
Category: code
CWE: CWE-328 - Weak Hash
CVSS: 7.5 (High)
Location: contracts/vault/strategies/univ4/CreatorLPManager.sol:479

Risk & Fix:
Math.random() is not cryptographically secure and can be predicted. Fix: Use the crypto module for generating tokens, secrets, or IDs.

Fix: Use bcrypt or Argon2
Estimated Time: 15-20 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: MD5/SHA1 is not suitable for passwords
const hash = crypto.createHash('md5').update(password).digest('hex');

After (Safe):
// Safe: Use bcrypt
import bcrypt from 'bcrypt';

// Hashing (on registration)
const saltRounds = 12;
const hash = await bcrypt.hash(password, saltRounds);

// Verification (on login)
const isValid = await bcrypt.compare(password, storedHash);

Difficulty: MEDIUM

// Vulnerable: MD5/SHA1 is not suitable for passwords
const hash = crypto.createHash('md5').update(password).digest('hex');

After (Safe):
// Safe: Use bcrypt
import bcrypt from 'bcrypt';

// Hashing (on registration)
const saltRounds = 12;
const hash = await bcrypt.hash(password, saltRounds);

// Verification (on login)
const isValid = await bcrypt.compare(password, storedHash);

Risk & Fix:

[1424] Using blockhash for randomness - miners can manipulate this value
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: MEDIUM
Category: code
CWE: CWE-328 - Weak Hash
CVSS: 7.5 (High)
Location: contracts/vault/strategies/univ4/LimitOrderStrategy.sol:666

Risk & Fix:
Math.random() is not cryptographically secure and can be predicted. Fix: Use the crypto module for generating tokens, secrets, or IDs.

Fix: Use bcrypt or Argon2
Estimated Time: 15-20 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: MD5/SHA1 is not suitable for passwords
const hash = crypto.createHash('md5').update(password).digest('hex');

After (Safe):
// Safe: Use bcrypt
import bcrypt from 'bcrypt';

// Hashing (on registration)
const saltRounds = 12;
const hash = await bcrypt.hash(password, saltRounds);

// Verification (on login)
const isValid = await bcrypt.compare(password, storedHash);

[1497] Using blockhash for randomness - miners can manipulate this value
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: MEDIUM
Category: code
CWE: CWE-328 - Weak Hash
CVSS: 7.5 (High)
Location: contracts/governance/VaultGaugeVoting.sol:191

Risk & Fix:
Math.random() is not cryptographically secure and can be predicted. Fix: Use the crypto module for generating tokens, secrets, or IDs.

Fix: Use bcrypt or Argon2
Estimated Time: 15-20 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: MD5/SHA1 is not suitable for passwords
const hash = crypto.createHash('md5').update(password).digest('hex');

After (Safe):
// Safe: Use bcrypt
import bcrypt from 'bcrypt';

// Hashing (on registration)
const saltRounds = 12;
const hash = await bcrypt.hash(password, saltRounds);

// Verification (on login)
const isValid = await bcrypt.compare(password, storedHash);

Risk & Fix:
Math.random() is not cryptographically secure and can be predicted. Fix: Use the crypto module for generating tokens, secrets, or IDs.

Fix: Use bcrypt or Argon2
Estimated Time: 15-20 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: MD5/SHA1 is not suitable for passwords
const hash = crypto.createHash('md5').update(password).digest('hex');

After (Safe):
// Safe: Use bcrypt
import bcrypt from 'bcrypt';

// Hashing (on registration)
const saltRounds = 12;
const hash = await bcrypt.hash(password, saltRounds);

// Verification (on login)
const isValid = await bcrypt.compare(password, storedHash);

[1634] Using blockhash for randomness - miners can manipulate this value
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: MEDIUM
Category: code
CWE: CWE-328 - Weak Hash
CVSS: 7.5 (High)
Location: contracts/services/lottery/CreatorLotteryManager.sol:489

Risk & Fix:
Math.random() is not cryptographically secure and can be predicted. Fix: Use the crypto module for generating tokens, secrets, or IDs.

Fix: Use bcrypt or Argon2
Estimated Time: 15-20 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: MD5/SHA1 is not suitable for passwords
const hash = crypto.createHash('md5').update(password).digest('hex');

After (Safe):
// Safe: Use bcrypt
import bcrypt from 'bcrypt';

// Hashing (on registration)
const saltRounds = 12;
const hash = await bcrypt.hash(password, saltRounds);

// Verification (on login)
const isValid = await bcrypt.compare(password, storedHash);

Location: contracts/services/lottery/vrf/CreatorVRFConsumerV2_5.sol:465

Risk & Fix:
Math.random() is not cryptographically secure and can be predicted. Fix: Use the crypto module for generating tokens, secrets, or IDs.

Fix: Use bcrypt or Argon2
Estimated Time: 15-20 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: MD5/SHA1 is not suitable for passwords
const hash = crypto.createHash('md5').update(password).digest('hex');

After (Safe):
// Safe: Use bcrypt
import bcrypt from 'bcrypt';

// Hashing (on registration)
const saltRounds = 12;
const hash = await bcrypt.hash(password, saltRounds);

// Verification (on login)
const isValid = await bcrypt.compare(password, storedHash);

Risk & Fix:
Math.random() is not cryptographically secure and can be predicted. Fix: Use the crypto module for generating tokens, secrets, or IDs.

Fix: Use bcrypt or Argon2
Estimated Time: 15-20 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: MD5/SHA1 is not suitable for passwords
const hash = crypto.createHash('md5').update(password).digest('hex');

After (Safe):
// Safe: Use bcrypt
import bcrypt from 'bcrypt';

// Hashing (on registration)
const saltRounds = 12;
const hash = await bcrypt.hash(password, saltRounds);

// Verification (on login)
const isValid = await bcrypt.compare(password, storedHash);

[2297] [Solhint] Import in script/DeployCreatorVaultBatcher.s.sol doesn't exist in: forge-std/Script.sol
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: LOW
Category: code
Location: script/DeployCreatorVaultBatcher.s.sol:4

Risk & Fix:
This pattern was flagged as a potential security issue. Review the code context and apply the recommended fix to prevent exploitation.

Fix: Validate and Sanitize File Paths
Estimated Time: 10-15 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: Path traversal
const filename = req.query.file;
const content = fs.readFileSync(`./uploads/${filename}`);

After (Safe):
import path from 'path';

const UPLOAD_DIR = path.resolve('./uploads');

function getSafePath(filename) {
  // Remove any path components
  const safeName = path.basename(filename);
  const fullPath = path.resolve(UPLOAD_DIR, safeName);

  // Ensure path is within upload directory
  if (!fullPath.startsWith(UPLOAD_DIR)) {
    throw new Error('Invalid path');
  }

  return fullPath;
}

const safePath = getSafePath(req.query.file);
const content = fs.readFileSync(safePath);

[2426] [Solhint] Import in contracts/vault/strategies/CCALaunchStrategy.sol doesn't exist in: @openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: LOW
Category: code
Location: contracts/vault/strategies/CCALaunchStrategy.sol:4

Risk & Fix:
This pattern was flagged as a potential security issue. Review the code context and apply the recommended fix to prevent exploitation.

Fix: Validate and Sanitize File Paths
Estimated Time: 10-15 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: Path traversal
const filename = req.query.file;
const content = fs.readFileSync(`./uploads/${filename}`);

After (Safe):
import path from 'path';

const UPLOAD_DIR = path.resolve('./uploads');

function getSafePath(filename) {
  // Remove any path components
  const safeName = path.basename(filename);
  const fullPath = path.resolve(UPLOAD_DIR, safeName);

  // Ensure path is within upload directory
  if (!fullPath.startsWith(UPLOAD_DIR)) {
    throw new Error('Invalid path');
  }

  return fullPath;
}

const safePath = getSafePath(req.query.file);
const content = fs.readFileSync(safePath);

const UPLOAD_DIR = path.resolve('./uploads');

function getSafePath(filename) {
  // Remove any path components
  const safeName = path.basename(filename);
  const fullPath = path.resolve(UPLOAD_DIR, safeName);

  // Ensure path is within upload directory
  if (!fullPath.startsWith(UPLOAD_DIR)) {
    throw new Error('Invalid path');
  }

  return fullPath;
}

const safePath = getSafePath(req.query.file);
const content = fs.readFileSync(safePath);

After (Safe):

  // Remove any path components

  // Ensure path is within upload directory
  if (!fullPath.startsWith(UPLOAD_DIR)) {
    throw new Error('Invalid path');
  }

  return fullPath;
}

This pattern was flagged as a potential security issue. Review the code context and apply the recommended fix to prevent exploitation.

Fix: Validate and Sanitize File Paths
Estimated Time: 10-15 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: Path traversal
const filename = req.query.file;
const content = fs.readFileSync(`./uploads/${filename}`);

After (Safe):
import path from 'path';

const UPLOAD_DIR = path.resolve('./uploads');

function getSafePath(filename) {
  // Remove any path components
  const safeName = path.basename(filename);
  const fullPath = path.resolve(UPLOAD_DIR, safeName);

  // Ensure path is within upload directory
  if (!fullPath.startsWith(UPLOAD_DIR)) {
    throw new Error('Invalid path');
  }

  return fullPath;
}

const safePath = getSafePath(req.query.file);
const content = fs.readFileSync(safePath);

const filename = req.query.file;
const content = fs.readFileSync(`./uploads/${filename}`);

After (Safe):
import path from 'path';

const UPLOAD_DIR = path.resolve('./uploads');

function getSafePath(filename) {
  // Remove any path components
  const safeName = path.basename(filename);
  const fullPath = path.resolve(UPLOAD_DIR, safeName);

  // Ensure path is within upload directory
  if (!fullPath.startsWith(UPLOAD_DIR)) {
    throw new Error('Invalid path');
  }

  return fullPath;
}

const safePath = getSafePath(req.query.file);
const content = fs.readFileSync(safePath);

[2688] [Solhint] Import in contracts/factories/VaultActivator.sol doesn't exist in: @openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: LOW
Category: code
Location: contracts/factories/VaultActivator.sol:4

Risk & Fix:
This pattern was flagged as a potential security issue. Review the code context and apply the recommended fix to prevent exploitation.

Fix: Validate and Sanitize File Paths
Estimated Time: 10-15 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: Path traversal
const filename = req.query.file;
const content = fs.readFileSync(`./uploads/${filename}`);

After (Safe):
import path from 'path';

const UPLOAD_DIR = path.resolve('./uploads');

function getSafePath(filename) {
  // Remove any path components
  const safeName = path.basename(filename);
  const fullPath = path.resolve(UPLOAD_DIR, safeName);

  // Ensure path is within upload directory
  if (!fullPath.startsWith(UPLOAD_DIR)) {
    throw new Error('Invalid path');
  }

  return fullPath;
}

const safePath = getSafePath(req.query.file);
const content = fs.readFileSync(safePath);

function getSafePath(filename) {
  // Remove any path components
  const safeName = path.basename(filename);
  const fullPath = path.resolve(UPLOAD_DIR, safeName);

  // Ensure path is within upload directory
  if (!fullPath.startsWith(UPLOAD_DIR)) {
    throw new Error('Invalid path');
  }

  return fullPath;
}

const safePath = getSafePath(req.query.file);
const content = fs.readFileSync(safePath);

[2797] [Solhint] Import in contracts/governance/veERC4626BoostManager.sol doesn't exist in: @openzeppelin/contracts/access/Ownable.sol
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: LOW
Category: code
Location: contracts/governance/veERC4626BoostManager.sol:11

Risk & Fix:
This pattern was flagged as a potential security issue. Review the code context and apply the recommended fix to prevent exploitation.

Fix: Validate and Sanitize File Paths
Estimated Time: 10-15 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: Path traversal
const filename = req.query.file;
const content = fs.readFileSync(`./uploads/${filename}`);

After (Safe):
import path from 'path';

const UPLOAD_DIR = path.resolve('./uploads');

function getSafePath(filename) {
  // Remove any path components
  const safeName = path.basename(filename);
  const fullPath = path.resolve(UPLOAD_DIR, safeName);

  // Ensure path is within upload directory
  if (!fullPath.startsWith(UPLOAD_DIR)) {
    throw new Error('Invalid path');
  }

  return fullPath;
}

const safePath = getSafePath(req.query.file);
const content = fs.readFileSync(safePath);

const UPLOAD_DIR = path.resolve('./uploads');

function getSafePath(filename) {
  // Remove any path components
  const safeName = path.basename(filename);
  const fullPath = path.resolve(UPLOAD_DIR, safeName);

  // Ensure path is within upload directory
  if (!fullPath.startsWith(UPLOAD_DIR)) {
    throw new Error('Invalid path');
  }

  return fullPath;
}

const safePath = getSafePath(req.query.file);
const content = fs.readFileSync(safePath);

[2905] [Solhint] Import in contracts/services/lottery/vrf/ChainlinkVRFIntegratorV2_5.sol doesn't exist in: @openzeppelin/contracts/access/Ownable.sol
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: LOW
Category: code
Location: contracts/services/lottery/vrf/ChainlinkVRFIntegratorV2_5.sol:14

Risk & Fix:
This pattern was flagged as a potential security issue. Review the code context and apply the recommended fix to prevent exploitation.

Fix: Validate and Sanitize File Paths
Estimated Time: 10-15 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: Path traversal
const filename = req.query.file;
const content = fs.readFileSync(`./uploads/${filename}`);

After (Safe):
import path from 'path';

const UPLOAD_DIR = path.resolve('./uploads');

function getSafePath(filename) {
  // Remove any path components
  const safeName = path.basename(filename);
  const fullPath = path.resolve(UPLOAD_DIR, safeName);

  // Ensure path is within upload directory
  if (!fullPath.startsWith(UPLOAD_DIR)) {
    throw new Error('Invalid path');
  }

  return fullPath;
}

const safePath = getSafePath(req.query.file);
const content = fs.readFileSync(safePath);

[2989] [Solhint] Import in contracts/services/oracles/CreatorOracle.sol doesn't exist in: @layerzerolabs/oapp-evm/contracts/oapp/OApp.sol
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: LOW
Category: code
Location: contracts/services/oracles/CreatorOracle.sol:4

Risk & Fix:
This pattern was flagged as a potential security issue. Review the code context and apply the recommended fix to prevent exploitation.

Fix: Validate and Sanitize File Paths
Estimated Time: 10-15 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: Path traversal
const filename = req.query.file;
const content = fs.readFileSync(`./uploads/${filename}`);

After (Safe):
import path from 'path';

const UPLOAD_DIR = path.resolve('./uploads');

function getSafePath(filename) {
  // Remove any path components
  const safeName = path.basename(filename);
  const fullPath = path.resolve(UPLOAD_DIR, safeName);

  // Ensure path is within upload directory
  if (!fullPath.startsWith(UPLOAD_DIR)) {
    throw new Error('Invalid path');
  }

  return fullPath;
}

const safePath = getSafePath(req.query.file);
const content = fs.readFileSync(safePath);

[3034] [Solhint] Import in contracts/services/bridge/SolanaBridgeAdapter.sol doesn't exist in: @openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: LOW
Category: code
Location: contracts/services/bridge/SolanaBridgeAdapter.sol:4

Risk & Fix:
This pattern was flagged as a potential security issue. Review the code context and apply the recommended fix to prevent exploitation.

Fix: Validate and Sanitize File Paths
Estimated Time: 10-15 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: Path traversal
const filename = req.query.file;
const content = fs.readFileSync(`./uploads/${filename}`);

After (Safe):
import path from 'path';

const UPLOAD_DIR = path.resolve('./uploads');

function getSafePath(filename) {
  // Remove any path components
  const safeName = path.basename(filename);
  const fullPath = path.resolve(UPLOAD_DIR, safeName);

  // Ensure path is within upload directory
  if (!fullPath.startsWith(UPLOAD_DIR)) {
    throw new Error('Invalid path');
  }

  return fullPath;
}

const safePath = getSafePath(req.query.file);
const content = fs.readFileSync(safePath);

Category: code
Location: contracts/helpers/routers/PayoutRouter.sol:4

Risk & Fix:
This pattern was flagged as a potential security issue. Review the code context and apply the recommended fix to prevent exploitation.

Fix: Validate and Sanitize File Paths
Estimated Time: 10-15 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: Path traversal
const filename = req.query.file;
const content = fs.readFileSync(`./uploads/${filename}`);

After (Safe):
import path from 'path';

const UPLOAD_DIR = path.resolve('./uploads');

function getSafePath(filename) {
  // Remove any path components
  const safeName = path.basename(filename);
  const fullPath = path.resolve(UPLOAD_DIR, safeName);

  // Ensure path is within upload directory
  if (!fullPath.startsWith(UPLOAD_DIR)) {
    throw new Error('Invalid path');
  }

  return fullPath;
}

const safePath = getSafePath(req.query.file);
const content = fs.readFileSync(safePath);

[3120] [Solhint] Import in contracts/helpers/batchers/CreatorVaultBatcher.sol doesn't exist in: @openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: LOW
Category: code
Location: contracts/helpers/batchers/CreatorVaultBatcher.sol:10

Risk & Fix:
This pattern was flagged as a potential security issue. Review the code context and apply the recommended fix to prevent exploitation.

Fix: Validate and Sanitize File Paths
Estimated Time: 10-15 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: Path traversal
const filename = req.query.file;
const content = fs.readFileSync(`./uploads/${filename}`);

After (Safe):
import path from 'path';

const UPLOAD_DIR = path.resolve('./uploads');

function getSafePath(filename) {
  // Remove any path components
  const safeName = path.basename(filename);
  const fullPath = path.resolve(UPLOAD_DIR, safeName);

  // Ensure path is within upload directory
  if (!fullPath.startsWith(UPLOAD_DIR)) {
    throw new Error('Invalid path');
  }

  return fullPath;
}

const safePath = getSafePath(req.query.file);
const content = fs.readFileSync(safePath);

[3144] Password reset endpoint - add rate limiting to prevent abuse
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: INFO
Category: code
CWE: CWE-798 - Hardcoded Credentials
CVSS: 9.8 (Critical)
Location: docs/examples/aa.js:28

Risk & Fix:
Passwords in code are a severe security risk. Anyone with code access can authenticate as that user/service. Fix: Remove immediately, use environment variables, rotate the password.

Fix: Use bcrypt or Argon2
Estimated Time: 15-20 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: MD5/SHA1 is not suitable for passwords
const hash = crypto.createHash('md5').update(password).digest('hex');

After (Safe):
// Safe: Use bcrypt
import bcrypt from 'bcrypt';

// Hashing (on registration)
const saltRounds = 12;
const hash = await bcrypt.hash(password, saltRounds);

// Verification (on login)
const isValid = await bcrypt.compare(password, storedHash);

[3168] URLSearchParams usage - ensure query data is sanitized before rendering (CWE-79)
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: INFO
Category: code
CWE: CWE-79 - Cross-site Scripting (XSS)
CVSS: 6.1 (Medium)
Location: frontend/src/pages/AdminCreatorAccess.tsx:52

Risk & Fix:
Attackers can inject malicious scripts that run in your users' browsers, stealing sessions, credentials, or personal data. Fix: Sanitize all user input before rendering, use textContent instead of innerHTML.

Fix: Use textContent or Sanitize HTML
Estimated Time: 5-15 min
Difficulty: EASY

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: XSS via innerHTML
element.innerHTML = userInput;

// React vulnerable pattern
<div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: userContent}} />

After (Safe):
// Safe: Use textContent for plain text
element.textContent = userInput;

// If HTML is needed, sanitize with DOMPurify
import DOMPurify from 'dompurify';
element.innerHTML = DOMPurify.sanitize(userInput);

// React with sanitization
<div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{
  __html: DOMPurify.sanitize(userContent)
}} />


[3169] Redirect URL validation may be bypassable (e.g., //evil.com, http://evil.com)
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: INFO
Category: code
CWE: CWE-601 - Open Redirect
CVSS: 6.1 (Medium)
Location: frontend/src/pages/CoinManage.tsx:56

Risk & Fix:
Unvalidated redirects enable phishing attacks that abuse your domain's trust. Fix: Check the redirect destination against allowed domains before redirecting.

Fix: Validate Redirect URLs
Estimated Time: 10-15 min
Difficulty: EASY

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: Open redirect
const returnUrl = req.query.returnUrl;
res.redirect(returnUrl);

After (Safe):
function getSafeRedirectUrl(url, allowedHosts) {
  try {
    const parsed = new URL(url, 'https://yourapp.com');

    // Only allow relative paths or whitelisted hosts
    if (parsed.origin === 'https://yourapp.com') {
      return parsed.pathname + parsed.search;
    }

    if (allowedHosts.includes(parsed.host)) {
      return url;
    }
  } catch {
    // Invalid URL
  }

  return '/'; // Default safe redirect
}

const safeUrl = getSafeRedirectUrl(
  req.query.returnUrl,
  ['auth.yourapp.com']
);
res.redirect(safeUrl);

[3180] Redirect URL validation may be bypassable (e.g., //evil.com, http://evil.com)
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: INFO
Category: code
CWE: CWE-601 - Open Redirect
CVSS: 6.1 (Medium)
Location: frontend/src/pages/CoinManage.tsx:146

Risk & Fix:
Unvalidated redirects enable phishing attacks that abuse your domain's trust. Fix: Check the redirect destination against allowed domains before redirecting.

Fix: Validate Redirect URLs
Estimated Time: 10-15 min
Difficulty: EASY

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: Open redirect
const returnUrl = req.query.returnUrl;
res.redirect(returnUrl);

After (Safe):
function getSafeRedirectUrl(url, allowedHosts) {
  try {
    const parsed = new URL(url, 'https://yourapp.com');

    // Only allow relative paths or whitelisted hosts
    if (parsed.origin === 'https://yourapp.com') {
      return parsed.pathname + parsed.search;
    }

    if (allowedHosts.includes(parsed.host)) {
      return url;
    }
  } catch {
    // Invalid URL
  }

  return '/'; // Default safe redirect
}

const safeUrl = getSafeRedirectUrl(
  req.query.returnUrl,
  ['auth.yourapp.com']
);
res.redirect(safeUrl);

[3207] URLSearchParams usage - ensure query data is sanitized before rendering (CWE-79)
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: INFO
Category: code
CWE: CWE-79 - Cross-site Scripting (XSS)
CVSS: 6.1 (Medium)
Location: frontend/src/pages/Status.tsx:291

Risk & Fix:
Attackers can inject malicious scripts that run in your users' browsers, stealing sessions, credentials, or personal data. Fix: Sanitize all user input before rendering, use textContent instead of innerHTML.

Fix: Use textContent or Sanitize HTML
Estimated Time: 5-15 min
Difficulty: EASY

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: XSS via innerHTML
element.innerHTML = userInput;

// React vulnerable pattern
<div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: userContent}} />

After (Safe):
// Safe: Use textContent for plain text
element.textContent = userInput;

// If HTML is needed, sanitize with DOMPurify
import DOMPurify from 'dompurify';
element.innerHTML = DOMPurify.sanitize(userInput);

// React with sanitization
<div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{
  __html: DOMPurify.sanitize(userContent)
}} />

[3287] Password reset endpoint - add rate limiting to prevent abuse
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: INFO
Category: code
CWE: CWE-798 - Hardcoded Credentials
CVSS: 9.8 (Critical)
Location: frontend/src/components/ConnectButtonWeb3.tsx:41

Risk & Fix:
Passwords in code are a severe security risk. Anyone with code access can authenticate as that user/service. Fix: Remove immediately, use environment variables, rotate the password.

Fix: Use bcrypt or Argon2
Estimated Time: 15-20 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: MD5/SHA1 is not suitable for passwords
const hash = crypto.createHash('md5').update(password).digest('hex');

After (Safe):
// Safe: Use bcrypt
import bcrypt from 'bcrypt';

// Hashing (on registration)
const saltRounds = 12;
const hash = await bcrypt.hash(password, saltRounds);

// Verification (on login)
const isValid = await bcrypt.compare(password, storedHash);

[3327] URLSearchParams usage - ensure query data is sanitized before rendering (CWE-79)
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: INFO
Category: code
CWE: CWE-79 - Cross-site Scripting (XSS)
CVSS: 6.1 (Medium)
Location: frontend/src/components/RouteDebugBadge.tsx:5

Risk & Fix:
Attackers can inject malicious scripts that run in your users' browsers, stealing sessions, credentials, or personal data. Fix: Sanitize all user input before rendering, use textContent instead of innerHTML.

Fix: Use textContent or Sanitize HTML
Estimated Time: 5-15 min
Difficulty: EASY

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: XSS via innerHTML
element.innerHTML = userInput;

// React vulnerable pattern
<div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: userContent}} />

After (Safe):
// Safe: Use textContent for plain text
element.textContent = userInput;

// If HTML is needed, sanitize with DOMPurify
import DOMPurify from 'dompurify';
element.innerHTML = DOMPurify.sanitize(userInput);

// React with sanitization
<div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{
  __html: DOMPurify.sanitize(userContent)
}} />

[3353] URLSearchParams usage - ensure query data is sanitized before rendering (CWE-79)
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: INFO
Category: code
CWE: CWE-79 - Cross-site Scripting (XSS)
CVSS: 6.1 (Medium)
Location: frontend/src/components/WalletDebugPanel.tsx:11

Risk & Fix:
Attackers can inject malicious scripts that run in your users' browsers, stealing sessions, credentials, or personal data. Fix: Sanitize all user input before rendering, use textContent instead of innerHTML.

Fix: Use textContent or Sanitize HTML
Estimated Time: 5-15 min
Difficulty: EASY

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: XSS via innerHTML
element.innerHTML = userInput;

// React vulnerable pattern
<div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: userContent}} />

After (Safe):
// Safe: Use textContent for plain text
element.textContent = userInput;

// If HTML is needed, sanitize with DOMPurify
import DOMPurify from 'dompurify';
element.innerHTML = DOMPurify.sanitize(userInput);

// React with sanitization
<div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{
  __html: DOMPurify.sanitize(userContent)
}} />

[3368] Redirect URL validation may be bypassable (e.g., //evil.com, http://evil.com)
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: INFO
Category: code
CWE: CWE-601 - Open Redirect
CVSS: 6.1 (Medium)
Location: frontend/src/components/cca/CreatorProfileCardSimple.tsx:75

Risk & Fix:
Unvalidated redirects enable phishing attacks that abuse your domain's trust. Fix: Check the redirect destination against allowed domains before redirecting.

Fix: Validate Redirect URLs
Estimated Time: 10-15 min
Difficulty: EASY

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: Open redirect
const returnUrl = req.query.returnUrl;
res.redirect(returnUrl);

After (Safe):
function getSafeRedirectUrl(url, allowedHosts) {
  try {
    const parsed = new URL(url, 'https://yourapp.com');

    // Only allow relative paths or whitelisted hosts
    if (parsed.origin === 'https://yourapp.com') {
      return parsed.pathname + parsed.search;
    }

    if (allowedHosts.includes(parsed.host)) {
      return url;
    }
  } catch {
    // Invalid URL
  }

  return '/'; // Default safe redirect
}

const safeUrl = getSafeRedirectUrl(
  req.query.returnUrl,
  ['auth.yourapp.com']
);
res.redirect(safeUrl);


[3369] Redirect URL validation may be bypassable (e.g., //evil.com, http://evil.com)
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: INFO
Category: code
CWE: CWE-601 - Open Redirect
CVSS: 6.1 (Medium)
Location: frontend/src/components/cca/CreatorProfileCardSimple.tsx:83

Risk & Fix:

After (Safe):
function getSafeRedirectUrl(url, allowedHosts) {
  try {
    const parsed = new URL(url, 'https://yourapp.com');

    // Only allow relative paths or whitelisted hosts
    if (parsed.origin === 'https://yourapp.com') {
      return parsed.pathname + parsed.search;
    }

    if (allowedHosts.includes(parsed.host)) {
      return url;
    }
  } catch {
    // Invalid URL
  }

  return '/'; // Default safe redirect
}

  req.query.returnUrl,
  ['auth.yourapp.com']
);
res.redirect(safeUrl);

[3371] Password reset endpoint - add rate limiting to prevent abuse
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: INFO
Category: code
CWE: CWE-798 - Hardcoded Credentials
CVSS: 9.8 (Critical)
Location: frontend/src/components/ve33/VaultGaugeVotingPanel.tsx:39

Risk & Fix:
Passwords in code are a severe security risk. Anyone with code access can authenticate as that user/service. Fix: Remove immediately, use environment variables, rotate the password.

Fix: Use bcrypt or Argon2
Estimated Time: 15-20 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: MD5/SHA1 is not suitable for passwords
const hash = crypto.createHash('md5').update(password).digest('hex');

After (Safe):
// Safe: Use bcrypt
import bcrypt from 'bcrypt';

// Hashing (on registration)
const saltRounds = 12;
const hash = await bcrypt.hash(password, saltRounds);

// Verification (on login)
const isValid = await bcrypt.compare(password, storedHash);


[3372] Password reset endpoint - add rate limiting to prevent abuse
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: INFO
Category: code
CWE: CWE-798 - Hardcoded Credentials
CVSS: 9.8 (Critical)
Location: frontend/src/components/ve33/VaultGaugeVotingPanel.tsx:93

Risk & Fix:
Passwords in code are a severe security risk. Anyone with code access can authenticate as that user/service. Fix: Remove immediately, use environment variables, rotate the password.

Fix: Use bcrypt or Argon2
Estimated Time: 15-20 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: MD5/SHA1 is not suitable for passwords

After (Safe):
// Safe: Use bcrypt

// Hashing (on registration)

const hash = await bcrypt.hash(password, saltRounds);

// Verification (on login)
const isValid = await bcrypt.compare(password, storedHash);

[3423] Password reset endpoint - add rate limiting to prevent abuse
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: INFO
Category: code
CWE: CWE-798 - Hardcoded Credentials
CVSS: 9.8 (Critical)
Location: frontend/src/hooks/useVaultGaugeVoting.ts:9

Risk & Fix:
Passwords in code are a severe security risk. Anyone with code access can authenticate as that user/service. Fix: Remove immediately, use environment variables, rotate the password.

Fix: Use bcrypt or Argon2
Estimated Time: 15-20 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: MD5/SHA1 is not suitable for passwords

After (Safe):
// Safe: Use bcrypt
import bcrypt from 'bcrypt';

// Hashing (on registration)
const saltRounds = 12;
const hash = await bcrypt.hash(password, saltRounds);

// Verification (on login)
const isValid = await bcrypt.compare(password, storedHash);

[3443] URLSearchParams usage - ensure query data is sanitized before rendering (CWE-79)
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: INFO
Category: code
CWE: CWE-79 - Cross-site Scripting (XSS)
CVSS: 6.1 (Medium)
Location: frontend/src/hooks/useCreatorAllowlist.ts:22

Risk & Fix:
Attackers can inject malicious scripts that run in your users' browsers, stealing sessions, credentials, or personal data. Fix: Sanitize all user input before rendering, use textContent instead of innerHTML.

Fix: Use textContent or Sanitize HTML
Estimated Time: 5-15 min
Difficulty: EASY

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: XSS via innerHTML
element.innerHTML = userInput;

// React vulnerable pattern
<div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: userContent}} />

After (Safe):
// Safe: Use textContent for plain text
element.textContent = userInput;

// If HTML is needed, sanitize with DOMPurify
import DOMPurify from 'dompurify';
element.innerHTML = DOMPurify.sanitize(userInput);

// React with sanitization
<div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{
  __html: DOMPurify.sanitize(userContent)
}} />

[3449] Redirect URL validation may be bypassable (e.g., //evil.com, http://evil.com)
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: INFO
Category: code
CWE: CWE-601 - Open Redirect
CVSS: 6.1 (Medium)
Location: frontend/src/hooks/useTokenMetadata.ts:32

Risk & Fix:
Unvalidated redirects enable phishing attacks that abuse your domain's trust. Fix: Check the redirect destination against allowed domains before redirecting.

Fix: Validate Redirect URLs
Estimated Time: 10-15 min
Difficulty: EASY

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: Open redirect
const returnUrl = req.query.returnUrl;
res.redirect(returnUrl);

After (Safe):
function getSafeRedirectUrl(url, allowedHosts) {
  try {
    const parsed = new URL(url, 'https://yourapp.com');

    // Only allow relative paths or whitelisted hosts
    if (parsed.origin === 'https://yourapp.com') {
      return parsed.pathname + parsed.search;
    }

    if (allowedHosts.includes(parsed.host)) {
      return url;
    }
  } catch {
    // Invalid URL
  }

  return '/'; // Default safe redirect
}

const safeUrl = getSafeRedirectUrl(
  req.query.returnUrl,
  ['auth.yourapp.com']
);
res.redirect(safeUrl);

[3525] Password reset endpoint - add rate limiting to prevent abuse
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: INFO
Category: code
CWE: CWE-798 - Hardcoded Credentials
CVSS: 9.8 (Critical)
Location: frontend/api/paymaster.ts:143

Risk & Fix:
Passwords in code are a severe security risk. Anyone with code access can authenticate as that user/service. Fix: Remove immediately, use environment variables, rotate the password.

Fix: Use bcrypt or Argon2
Estimated Time: 15-20 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: MD5/SHA1 is not suitable for passwords
const hash = crypto.createHash('md5').update(password).digest('hex');

After (Safe):
// Safe: Use bcrypt
import bcrypt from 'bcrypt';

// Hashing (on registration)
const saltRounds = 12;
const hash = await bcrypt.hash(password, saltRounds);

// Verification (on login)
const isValid = await bcrypt.compare(password, storedHash);

Severity: INFO
Category: code
Location: frontend/api/paymaster.ts:148

Risk & Fix:
This pattern was flagged as a potential security issue. Review the code context and apply the recommended fix to prevent exploitation.

[3541] Variable sent to response - ensure HTML encoding if rendering user-controlled data
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: INFO
Category: code
CWE: CWE-79 - Cross-site Scripting (XSS)
CVSS: 6.1 (Medium)
Location: frontend/api/paymaster.ts:582

Risk & Fix:
Attackers can inject malicious scripts that run in your users' browsers, stealing sessions, credentials, or personal data. Fix: Sanitize all user input before rendering, use textContent instead of innerHTML.

Fix: Use textContent or Sanitize HTML
Estimated Time: 5-15 min
Difficulty: EASY

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: XSS via innerHTML
element.innerHTML = userInput;

// React vulnerable pattern
<div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: userContent}} />

After (Safe):
// Safe: Use textContent for plain text
element.textContent = userInput;

// If HTML is needed, sanitize with DOMPurify
import DOMPurify from 'dompurify';
element.innerHTML = DOMPurify.sanitize(userInput);

// React with sanitization
<div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{
  __html: DOMPurify.sanitize(userContent)
}} />

[3548] path.normalize alone does not prevent traversal - validate path is within allowed directory
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: INFO
Category: code
Location: frontend/api/agent/invokeSkill.ts:59

Risk & Fix:
This pattern was flagged as a potential security issue. Review the code context and apply the recommended fix to prevent exploitation.

Fix: Validate and Sanitize File Paths
Estimated Time: 10-15 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: Path traversal
const filename = req.query.file;
const content = fs.readFileSync(`./uploads/${filename}`);

After (Safe):
import path from 'path';

const UPLOAD_DIR = path.resolve('./uploads');

function getSafePath(filename) {
  // Remove any path components
  const safeName = path.basename(filename);
  const fullPath = path.resolve(UPLOAD_DIR, safeName);

  // Ensure path is within upload directory
  if (!fullPath.startsWith(UPLOAD_DIR)) {
    throw new Error('Invalid path');
  }

  return fullPath;
}

const safePath = getSafePath(req.query.file);
const content = fs.readFileSync(safePath);

[3587] Redirect URL validation may be bypassable (e.g., //evil.com, http://evil.com)
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: INFO
Category: code
CWE: CWE-601 - Open Redirect
CVSS: 6.1 (Medium)
Location: frontend/api/_lib/skills.ts:34

Risk & Fix:
Unvalidated redirects enable phishing attacks that abuse your domain's trust. Fix: Check the redirect destination against allowed domains before redirecting.

Fix: Validate Redirect URLs
Estimated Time: 10-15 min
Difficulty: EASY

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: Open redirect
const returnUrl = req.query.returnUrl;
res.redirect(returnUrl);

After (Safe):
function getSafeRedirectUrl(url, allowedHosts) {
  try {
    const parsed = new URL(url, 'https://yourapp.com');

    // Only allow relative paths or whitelisted hosts
    if (parsed.origin === 'https://yourapp.com') {
      return parsed.pathname + parsed.search;
    }

    if (allowedHosts.includes(parsed.host)) {
      return url;
    }
  } catch {
    // Invalid URL
  }

  return '/'; // Default safe redirect
}

const safeUrl = getSafeRedirectUrl(
  req.query.returnUrl,
  ['auth.yourapp.com']
);
res.redirect(safeUrl);


[3588] Redirect URL validation may be bypassable (e.g., //evil.com, http://evil.com)
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: INFO
Category: code
CWE: CWE-601 - Open Redirect
CVSS: 6.1 (Medium)
Location: frontend/api/_lib/skills.ts:52

Risk & Fix:

Fix: Validate Redirect URLs
Estimated Time: 10-15 min
Difficulty: EASY

Before (Vulnerable):

After (Safe):
function getSafeRedirectUrl(url, allowedHosts) {
  try {
    const parsed = new URL(url, 'https://yourapp.com');

    // Only allow relative paths or whitelisted hosts
    if (parsed.origin === 'https://yourapp.com') {
      return parsed.pathname + parsed.search;
    }

    if (allowedHosts.includes(parsed.host)) {
      return url;
    }
  } catch {
    // Invalid URL
  }

  return '/'; // Default safe redirect
}

  req.query.returnUrl,
  ['auth.yourapp.com']
);
res.redirect(safeUrl);

--------------------------------------------------
Severity: INFO
Category: code

[3592] Password reset endpoint - add rate limiting to prevent abuse
--------------------------------------------------
Severity: INFO
Category: code
CWE: CWE-798 - Hardcoded Credentials
CVSS: 9.8 (Critical)
Location: frontend/api/debank/totalBalanceBatch.ts:7

Risk & Fix:
Passwords in code are a severe security risk. Anyone with code access can authenticate as that user/service. Fix: Remove immediately, use environment variables, rotate the password.

Fix: Use bcrypt or Argon2
Estimated Time: 15-20 min
Difficulty: MEDIUM

Before (Vulnerable):
// Vulnerable: MD5/SHA1 is not suitable for passwords
const hash = crypto.createHash('md5').update(password).digest('hex');

After (Safe):
// Safe: Use bcrypt
import bcrypt from 'bcrypt';

// Hashing (on registration)
const saltRounds = 12;
const hash = await bcrypt.hash(password, saltRounds);

// Verification (on login)
const isValid = await bcrypt.compare(password, storedHash);
